text:
Allow me to extend my warmest wishes to Your Excellency PM @narendramodi on the occasion of your 75th birthday. 
Â 
May this year be prosperous in both your personal and professional endeavours. It is my firm hope that the strong bond of solidarity and friendship between South Africa and India will continue to flourish under your inspirational leadership.
Â 
I express hope for Your Excellencyâ€™s continued good health and wish you continued success in your esteemed role as the leader of the Republic of India.
author: Cyril Ramaphosa ðŸ‡¿ðŸ‡¦

text:
Honourable Members,
Â 
It is vital that the National Council on Gender-Based Violence and Femicide is established with the authority and resources outlined in the Act. 
Â 
The interim allocation of R5 million for the secretariat is a transitional measure, enabling the coordination of the implementation of the National Strategic Plan against GBVF.
Â 
To ensure that the National Council is able to fulfil its critical functions, National Treasury has approved the Council as a separate sub programme with ring-fenced funds from 1 April 2026.
Â 
The Council is planned for establishment from 1 April 2026, following due processes.
Â 
Ministers have nominated government representatives to the Council and the relevant Portfolio Committee in the National Assembly will call for civil society and private sector nominations. 
Â 
The Board will appoint the CEO and secretariat staff.
Â 
Draft Regulations to coordinate provincial and local GBVF structures are being developed.
Â 
The strength of the National Strategic Plan lies in mobilising multiple stakeholders and mainstreaming this work across government. 
Â 
Every government department and entity is expected to contribute to the implementation of the National Strategic Plan within its mandate, while the National Council provides leadership and oversight.
Â 
All relevent government departments have dedicated funds towards the implementation of those pillars of the National Strategic Plan that fall within their respective areas of responsibility.
Â 
While the work to establish the National Council is underway, the implementation of the NSP is proceeding. 
Â 
For example, the GBVF Natjoints established in April has strengthened government-wide coordination.
Â 
Awareness campaigns, school and university interventions are ongoing.
Â 
Sexual Offences Courts, Thuthuzela Care Centres and GBV desks are operational nationwide.
Â 
Psychosocial support and integrated services are provided through the Department of Social Development, Khuseleka One-Stop Centres and the GBV Command Centre.
Â 
There is also progress with economic empowerment initiatives, mainly through improving the access of women-owned businesses to procurement opportunities in both government and the private sector.
Â 
These initiatives show that the National Strategic Plan is a living framework. 
Â 
The National Council is expected, once operational, toaccelerate this progress through stronger oversight, coordination and accountability.
Â 
Gender-based violence and femicide is a stain on the conscience of our nation. 
Â 
The National Council is an important instrument in strengthening our response to this epidemic, ensuring that all South Africans are mobilised to ensure that is brought to an end.

#RamaphosaQandA

We believe that every woman has autonomy over her sexuality and reproductive choices. Every adolescent should get comprehensive sexual education. Every person should be free from sexually transmitted diseases.
 https://t.co/NONKp4iTCc

text:
The moral imperative is clear: no woman, child or adolescent should die of preventable causes.
 https://t.co/NONKp4iTCc
author: Cyril Ramaphosa ðŸ‡¿ðŸ‡¦

text:
The reality that we must confront is that too many women still die in childbirth of preventable causes. 
Â 
Too many children and adolescents still suffer and die from illnesses we know how to prevent or treat. 
Â 
 https://t.co/NONKp4iTCc

The greatest challenge we face in this country is the pandemic of violence against women and children. 
Â 
We condemn the many high cases of gender-based violence and femicide recorded in our nation.

text:
Clean water is not a luxury. It is a right.
Â 
Poor water quality leads to public health crises, economic hardship and a breakdown of confidence in our institutions.
Â 
 https://t.co/KApSvzJCCK
author: Cyril Ramaphosa ðŸ‡¿ðŸ‡¦

text:
Our people expect clean water when they turn on the tap.
Â 
They deserve water that is free from contaminants and that meets the highest global standards.
Â 
 https://t.co/KApSvzJCCK

text:
Today, our thoughts are with Banyana Banyanaâ€™s @G_Salgado9 as we wish Gabriela a comfortable and speedy recovery from her traumatic injury in last nightâ€™s WAFCON semi-final against a victorious Nigeria.

I know youâ€™re a woman of deep and public faith, Gabriela, and youâ€™re a woman of bravery and skill on the pitch.

The nation wishes you well.

Casablanca was always going to be a tough ask for our national team as Africaâ€™s defending champions and Nigeriaâ€™s breakthrough in extra time proved this.

We are confident Banyana Banyana will regroup and return to WAFCON as future champs.

We wish Nigeriaâ€™s Super Falcons and Moroccoâ€™s Atlas Lionesses well for Saturdayâ€™s dream home final for the host nation.

text:
Congratulations to Gerda Steyn and Tete Dijana on racing to the top of the podium in the 98th Comrades Marathon.

For both of you and the millions watching this international showcase of endurance of body and mind, the Down Run was a captivating achievement that made our nation proud.

We congratulate your podium companions as well as the more than 22 000 runners for whom the Comrades is a way of life and an annual surge of inspiration not only across the Valley of a Thousand Hills but in every corner of the world.
author: Cyril Ramaphosa ðŸ‡¿ðŸ‡¦
